message_1:
A researcher wants to investigate the effect of fertilizer on the growth of plants. The researcher decides to conduct an experiment with two types of fertilizer: type A and type B. The researcher randomly assigns 10 plants to each group (fertilizer type A and fertilizer type B) and measures the height of each plant after 4 weeks. The heights of the plants in each group are recorded in the table below:

Type A: 12.5, 13, 14, 12, 13.5, 12, 13.5, 14, 11, 12.5
Type B: 14, 14.5, 15, 15.5, 13, 14.5, 16, 15, 14, 13.5

Calculate the mean and standard deviation of the height of the plants in each group.
message_2:
First, we will calculate the mean of each group:

Mean of Type A:
(12.5 + 13 + 14 + 12 + 13.5 + 12 + 13.5 + 14 + 11 + 12.5) / 10 = 130 / 10 = 13

Mean of Type B:
(14 + 14.5 + 15 + 15.5 + 13 + 14.5 + 16 + 15 + 14 + 13.5) / 10 = 145 / 10 = 14.5

Next, we will calculate the standard deviation of each group:

Standard Deviation of Type A:
1. Calculate the squared difference between each value and the mean: 
[(12.5-13)^2, (13-13)^2, (14-13)^2, (12-13)^2, (13.5-13)^2, (12-13)^2, (13.5-13)^2, (14-13)^2, (11-13)^2, (12.5-13)^2] = [0.25, 0, 1, 1, 0.25, 1, 0.25, 1, 4, 0.25]

2. Calculate the average of these squared differences: 
(0.25 + 0 + 1 + 1 + 0.25 + 1 + 0.25 + 1 + 4 + 0.25) / 10 = 8 / 10 = 0.8

3. Take the square root of the average: 
√0.8 ≈ 0.89

Standard Deviation of Type A ≈ 0.89

Standard Deviation of Type B:
1. Calculate the squared difference between each value and the mean: 
[(14-14.5)^2, (14.5-14.5)^2, (15-14.5)^2, (15.5-14.5)^2, (13-14.5)^2, (14.5-14.5)^2, (16-14.5)^2, (15-14.5)^2, (14-14.5)^2, (13.5-14.5)^2] = [0.25, 0, 0.25, 1, 2.25, 0, 2.25, 0.25, 0.25, 1]

2. Calculate the average of these squared differences: 
(0.25 + 0 + 0.25 + 1 + 2.25 + 0 + 2.25 + 0.25 + 0.25 + 1) / 10 = 7.5 / 10 = 0.75

3. Take the square root of the average: 
√0.75 ≈ 0.87

Standard Deviation of Type B ≈ 0.87

In summary, the mean height of plants in Type A group is 13, with a standard deviation of approximately 0.89. The mean height of plants in Type B group is 14.5, with a standard deviation of approximately 0.87.
